title: Script used on new In Love With Cole Porter Album Cover
content:
Hi,

Does anyone know what script is used inside the skyline in this album cover?

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130823102524im_/http:/typophile.com/files/in_love_with_cole_porter_album_cover_6347.png)
author: bfingeroth

comments.content: The artists listed suggest that this album was released in the 1950s or 1960s, which probably means that it was hand-lettered...

Thanks. You might be right, but I have a feeling it was done more recently. The album was released recently by Starbucks (one of their own compilations), so the artwork is new. It may be the handwriting of the graphic designer who did it but it feels like a recent script, hand-lettered font.

I'm with Nick on this one. Most probably hand-lettered and even it could have been done recently. All repeating look different to me, I can count no more than 10 different /o.  
Suggestions for similars: [http://typophile.com/node/96063#comment-521192](http://web.archive.org/web/20130823102524/http:/typophile.com/node/96063#comment-521192 "http://typophile.com/node/96063#comment-521192")
